title: Ticket #4272: RPM: Cluster of LOCAL_DISK_LOCK_DIR problems
description:
Installing from RPM (at least the OSG RPM), our default setting in /src/condor_examples/condor_config.generic.redhat for LOCAL_DISK_LOCK_DIR=$(LOG)/condorLocks .

These all need to be verified, but they come from a former team member so I'm prone to trust them:

  1. Bug: Install doesn't create the directory, nor does HTCondor itself. One of the two should.
  2. Bug: When the directory doesn't exist, it defaults to /tmp/condorLocks. Not finding the lock directory should probably be a fatal error. Using an unexpected location can cause strange results; in Dan's case /tmp ran out of inodes.
  3. Bug: If the directory is missing, condor_preen cleans tries to clean the missing directory, not where the files actually went. Fixing bug 2 should fix this, but ideally condor_preen should identify the lock directory identically to how the other programs do.
